workflow.name: Simple scheduling and internal document query bot with Telegram
workflow.description:
Template Overview This workflow demonstrates how to build a simple Telegram bot that can schedule events, check service prices, and query company documents using AI integrated with MCP and RAG. It‚Äôs designed to show how n8n can connect conversational interfaces with internal tools in a clear and scalable way.

Key Concepts (explained simply):

MCP (Multi‚ÄëChannel Processing): A framework that lets the AI agent connect to external services (like Google Calendar, Docs, Sheets) through MCP Clients and Servers. Think of it as the ‚Äúbridge‚Äù between the bot and your tools.

RAG (Retrieval‚ÄëAugmented Generation): A method where the AI retrieves information from documents before generating a response. This ensures answers are accurate and based on your actual data, not just the AI‚Äôs memory.

‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions (step‚Äëby‚Äëstep)
Create a Telegram Bot

Use BotFather to generate a bot and get the API token.

Configure Google Services

Make sure you have access to Google Calendar, Docs, and Sheets.

Connect them via MCP Server so the agent can call these tools.

Set up Redis Memory

Create an Upstash Redis account.

Configure it in the workflow to store conversation history.

Import the Template into n8n

Load the workflow and update credentials (Telegram, Google, Redis).

Test the Bot

Send a message like ‚ÄúSchedule laptop maintenance tomorrow‚Äù and check if it creates an event in Google Calendar.

üõ† Troubleshooting Section
Bot not responding?

Verify your Telegram API token is correct.

Google services not working?

Check that your MCP Server is running and properly connected to Calendar, Docs, and Sheets.

Conversation context lost?

Ensure Redis memory is configured and accessible.

Wrong date/time?

Confirm that relative dates (‚Äútomorrow‚Äù, ‚Äúnext week‚Äù) are being converted into ISO format correctly.

Customization Examples
This template is flexible and can be adapted to different scenarios. Here are some ideas:

Change the communication channel Replace the Telegram Trigger with WhatsApp, Slack, or a Webhook to fit your preferred platform.

Expand document sources Connect additional Google Docs or Sheets, or integrate with other storage (e.g., Notion, Confluence, or internal databases) to broaden the bot‚Äôs knowledge base.

Add new services Extend the workflow to handle more requests, such as booking meeting rooms, checking inventory, or creating support tickets.

Personalize responses Customize the AI Agent‚Äôs tone and style to match your company‚Äôs branding (formal, friendly, or technical).

Segment agents by role Create specialized agents (e.g., one for scheduling, one for pricing, one for troubleshooting) to keep the workflow modular and scalable.

Integrate external APIs Connect to services like Google Calendar, CRM systems, or helpdesk platforms to automate more complex tasks.

workflow.name: Simple Scheduling and Internal Document Query Bot with Telegram

parameters.content:
## Try it !
### This n8n template shows how to use AI with MCP to query internal IT shop documents, enabling scheduling, price checks, and company information in a single workflow.

### Examples: schedule laptop maintenance, check service prices (SSD/RAM upgrades), view company details (history, mission, service area), or access troubleshooting guides for technical support.

### How it works
* User interacts with the bot via Telegram (or another connected channel).
* The AI Agent processes the text and detects intent:
	* Scheduling ‚Üí creates/queries events in Google Calendar
	* Price check ‚Üí retrieves values from Google Sheets
	* Company info ‚Üí queries Google Docs
	* Troubleshooting ‚Üí accesses support sheet with diagnostic steps
* The agent replies clearly and helpfully to the user.

### How to use
* Telegram Trigger is included as an example, but you can replace it with WhatsApp, Webhook, or form integrations.
* The workflow can be expanded with more documents, services, or channels.
* Agents can be segmented (e.g., receptionist ‚Üí specialized agents) for modular and scalable flows.


### Requiriments
* Google account with access to Calendar, Docs, and Sheets
* MCP Server configured to connect these services
* Telegram integration node (or other input/output channel)
* Upstash account for Redis memory

### Next versions (planned)
* Separate specialized agents (scheduling, pricing, troubleshooting) for modularity
* Voice support in Telegram (voice input/output for scheduling)
* More advanced RAG with embeddings and vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus) for smarter document queries
* Expansion of internal documents and integration with more support tools


### Need Help ?
Join the Discord or ask in the Forum!
üöÄ Happy automations! 
üíª Happy Hacking!

## 1. Message Reception, Processing, and Output (Telegram + AI Agent)
* Telegram Trigger captures the user‚Äôs text input.
* AI Agent interprets the user‚Äôs intent and keeps conversation context with memory.
* MCP Clients connect to MCP Servers, enabling the agent to call external tools (Google Calendar, Docs, Sheets).
* Upstash Redis stores the conversation history, ensuring continuity across interactions.
* Result: The agent decides whether to handle scheduling, price queries, or company information.

## 2. Scheduling (Google Calendar via MCP)
Description: Handles all scheduling operations.
When the AI Agent detects a scheduling intent, it triggers the MCP Client connected to Google Calendar.

options.systemMessage:
<role> Voc√™ √© o Agente de IA da Loja de TI. Sua fun√ß√£o √© atender clientes de forma simp√°tica e profissional, interpretando suas solicita√ß√µes e consultando documentos internos via MCP (Google Calendar, Google Docs e Google Sheets). </role>

<instructions> <goal> Seu objetivo √© ajudar clientes da Loja de TI com: - Agendamento de servi√ßos via Google Calendar - Consulta de pre√ßos e produtos via Google Sheets - Consulta de informa√ß√µes institucionais e orienta√ß√µes via Google Docs </goal>

<context> Ferramentas dispon√≠veis:

Google Calendar (MCP) ‚Ä¢ Criar, listar, atualizar ou excluir eventos ‚Ä¢ Converter datas relativas ("hoje", "amanh√£", "semana que vem") em datas absolutas ISO antes de consultar

Google Sheets (MCP) ‚Ä¢ Consultar tabela de servi√ßos e produtos com valores ‚Ä¢ Responder perguntas como "Quanto custa a troca de HD para SSD?" ou "Qual o pre√ßo da consultoria em infraestrutura?"

Google Docs (MCP) ‚Ä¢ Consultar o guia institucional da Loja de TI ‚Ä¢ Responder perguntas sobre hist√≥ria da empresa, regi√£o de atendimento, miss√£o, especializa√ß√µes e diferenciais

Date & Time Tool ‚Ä¢ Sempre consultar esta ferramenta para obter a data atual completa (dia, m√™s e ano) ‚Ä¢ Usar este valor como refer√™ncia para interpretar datas relativas ‚Ä¢ Regras:

"hoje" ‚Üí data atual fornecida pela ferramenta

"amanh√£" ‚Üí +1 dia

"depois de amanh√£" ‚Üí +2 dias

"semana que vem" ‚Üí +7 dias ‚Ä¢ Converter sempre para formato ISO antes de enviar ao Calendar (ex.: 2025-11-25T00:00:00 at√© 2025-11-25T23:59:59)

Boas pr√°ticas:

Responder de forma clara, amig√°vel e educativa

Sempre responder em texto simples (plain text), sem usar Markdown ou HTML

Explicar ao usu√°rio como a informa√ß√£o foi obtida (ex.: "Consultei nossa tabela de servi√ßos no Google Sheets...")

Sempre seguir o fluxo: interpretar ‚Üí consultar ferramenta ‚Üí responder </context>

<output_format> Responda apenas em texto simples, sem Markdown ou HTML. Responda de forma clara, amig√°vel e objetiva. - Para agendamentos: confirmar data/hora e criar evento no Calendar - Para pre√ßos: consultar planilha e informar valor com clareza - Para informa√ß√µes institucionais: consultar documento e responder com base no guia - Sempre apresentar o resultado de forma compreens√≠vel e profissional </output_format>

<examples> ‚Ä¢ Usu√°rio: "Quais hor√°rios est√£o livres amanh√£ para manuten√ß√£o?" ‚Üí Consultar Date & Time Tool para obter a data atual, calcular +1 dia, converter para ISO e consultar Google Calendar.

‚Ä¢ Usu√°rio: "Quanto custa a troca de HD para SSD?" ‚Üí Consultar Google Sheets e responder: "O valor √© R$ 450,00."

‚Ä¢ Usu√°rio: "Voc√™s atendem fora de S√£o Paulo?" ‚Üí Consultar Google Docs e responder: "Atendemos principalmente a regi√£o metropolitana de S√£o Paulo, mas tamb√©m oferecemos suporte remoto em todo o Brasil." </examples> </instructions>

parameters.content:
## 3. Internal Queries (Google Docs & Google Sheets via MCP)
Description: Handles queries about internal IT shop information.

Google Sheets: Used to retrieve service and product prices.
   Example: ‚ÄúHow much does SSD upgrade cost?‚Äù ‚Üí returns $450.

Google Docs: Used to access the company‚Äôs institutional guide.
    Example: ‚ÄúDo you serve outside S√£o Paulo?‚Äù ‚Üí returns service area and remote support info.

Troubleshooting Sheets: Provide diagnostic steps to help users solve technical issues with laptops.
